image.altText: Mindil Beach Sunset Market

props.synopsis: Each dry season thousands of tourists flock to Darwin's Mindil Beach Sunset Markets, but this year wet season tides and waves have washed away half the beach, restricting access. It's left Darwin council the latest scrambling to find a solution to coastal erosion.

title.children: 'The damage is just phenomenal': Coastal erosion to impact Darwin's famous sunset markets

image.altText: Aerial view of an airbase with a runway surrounded by trees.

props.synopsis: Locals are alarmed that Chinese men dropped on a remote beach were able to enter an Australian airbase undetected, given the ramping up of surveillance along the crocodile-infested coastline.

title.children: Despite increased surveillance, Chinese men walked onto a northern Australian airstrip

image.altText: A split image shows Arj Barker speaking into a microphone on stage and a woman with a baby strapped to her and cardboard sign

props.synopsis: It really should come as no surprise to Arj Barker that the eviction of a breastfeeding mother from his Melbourne show has whipped up another round of culture wars, but these situations are complicated by differing experiences and emotional triggers — and culture wars aren't good with detail.

title.children: Australia's culture wars are back on the topic of breasts. It's no great surprise, but perhaps this time there's a lesson

image.altText: Summer Van Andel and Gabrielle Taylor sit at a table inside their home.

props.synopsis: Summer Van Andel and her younger brother were sitting on their couch when a toy car powered by a lithium-ion battery exploded while on charge in December last year.  It's just one of more than 1,000 fires caused by the batteries in Australia in 2023.

title.children: 'A bomb in the house': Calls for stronger laws to protect buyers when batteries explode

image.altText: Composite image of Brittany Higgins and Defence Minister Linda Reynolds

props.synopsis: Senator Linda Reynolds sues her former political staffer Brittany Higgins and Ms Higgins's partner David Sharaz for defamation over a series of social media posts — and neither side appears willing to back down.

title.children: Brittany Higgins is fighting her former boss in court. Here's what you need to know

image.altText: A profile image of a woman with long, ice blonde hair. She has a slight smile on her face.

props.synopsis: NSW man Daniel Billings has faced court charged with murdering childcare worker Molly Ticehurst, 28. Prime Minister Anthony Albanese says the government will look at "every measure" to stop the "horrifying" rates of violence against women.

title.children: Man charged with murdering Molly Ticehurst was on bail for charges of rape, stalking, court hears

image.altText: Turquoise water in a cave lake with two explorers - one is on a kayak.

props.synopsis: The Nullarbor Plain is famous for being dry, flat and featureless — but it's a very different story beneath the surface, with an intricate cave system that has remained mostly untouched.

title.children: A subterranean wonderland lies beneath the Nullarbor. A battle between energy and the environment looms in its future

image.altText: Composite image of Gough Whitlam in front of a shot of Pine Gap, Alice Springs

props.synopsis: During the 1972 election campaign, Gough Whitlam promised to lift the lid on Pine Gap and share its secrets. Ultimately, as prime minister, he was left out of the loop.

title.children: US bases saw Australia put on nuclear alert, but no-one told the prime minister

image.altText: an aerial photo of a gas well.

props.synopsis: Chief Minister Eva Lawler says the nine-year agreement with Tamboran Resources will provide the NT with 40 terajoules of gas per day, starting next year.

title.children: NT government signs deal to buy fracked Beetaloo Basin gas

image.altText: The PM speaking next to the AFP commissioner Reece Kershaw and ASIO boss Mike Burgess

props.synopsis: Social media companies are slammed by Australia's top police officer for "pouring accelerant on the flames" of misinformation and extremism on their platforms, while the boss of ASIO raises concerns encrypted chat services are a "safe room for terrorists and spies".

title.children: Top cop and spy boss urge social media companies to do better on encryption

image.altText: A production line of solar panels at Sunman Energy

props.synopsis: Twenty years ago China built a solar manufacturing industry on the back of Australian innovation. Now, as Australia tries to build a solar industry of its own, it needs assistance from China.

title.children: The plan to build a solar industry in Australia relies on a crucial ingredient: Help from China

image.altText: A group of women go for a run

props.synopsis: When women pick out a sports bra they're probably not thinking of their knees, but surprising new research shows there's a link between breast support and serious knee injuries.

title.children: Want to look after your knees when you run? The answer could be in your bra

image.altText: A young woman and her dog sit next to each other on a beach.

props.synopsis: Police say compelling information has been uncovered as a group of five country officers bring a renewed focus to giving Seaford woman Marcia Ryan's family the answers they have been seeking since 1996.

title.children: Marcia Ryan disappeared 28 years ago. Now police are reopening their investigation

image.altText: maggie rogers 2024

props.synopsis: Maggie Rogers's Fleetwood Mac-inspired third album is one of the best new releases you should wrap your ears around this week.

title.children: Five new albums that will please fans of Fleetwood Mac, Nick Cave, BROCKHAMPTON and more

image.altText: A mother sits in the driver's seat of a parked car, next to her daughter in the front passenger seat.

props.synopsis: Every Australian state has now outlawed or promised to ban rental bidding, but families are still being priced out of rentals or forced to move back in with their parents.

title.children: Rechel is trying to find a home but can't compete with people bidding for rentals

props.synopsis: The social media platform X is expected to return to the Federal Court today to argue why it should not have to hide footage of the Wakeley stabbing.

title.children: 'Elon vs Australia' returns to court today. Here's what to expect

image.altText: Tanya Egerton NT rural womens award pictured leaning on the front of her truck.

props.synopsis: An op shop project which donates clothes to Indigenous communities is set to expand after its win at the 2024 NT Agrifutures awards.

title.children: Remote op shop initiative wins NT Rural Women's Award

image.altText: A man in blue vest and an orange and green scarf kneels down.

props.synopsis: India's main opposition party has accused the prime minister of using "hate speech" after he called Muslims "infiltrators" at an election rally.

title.children: Modi accused of using 'hate speech' for calling Muslims 'infiltrators' at election rally

image.altText: Two women walking next to each other on the street. They are wearing face masks and jackets

props.synopsis: A Senate committee has recommended a royal commission to examine Australia's response to the COVID-19 pandemic and its impacts on the community, including of lockdown and quarantine measures.

title.children: A Senate committee has called for a royal commission into Australia's COVID response. Here's why it's not happening

image.altText: Four women stand outside a courthouse holding a document.

props.synopsis: The NSW State Coroner finds racism tainted an "inexplicably deficient" police investigation into the 1987 deaths of two Indigenous girls.

title.children: Racism tainted investigation into 1987 deaths of Aboriginal teenagers, coroner finds

image.altText: Elon Musk between the Twitter and X logos.

props.synopsis: There has been no shortage of criticism from across the political aisle levelled at tech billionaire Elon Musk for refusing to take down graphic footage in a Sydney church. But this spat is about more than just free speech; it's about power.

title.children: Elon Musk's fight with Australian regulators isn't really about the Sydney church attack, or even free speech. It's about power

image.altText: Black and white photo of Johnny Cash looking into the camera while playing an acoustic guitar

props.synopsis: An album recorded just months before Johnny Cash began his acclaimed American series of releases has been unearthed from the archives and will be released this June.

title.children: 'Lost' Johnny Cash album from 1993 has never seen the light of day. Until now

image.altText: Composite image of spears and a young man.

props.synopsis: Four spears stolen by Captain James Cook and his crew after he arrived at Botany Bay more than 250 years ago are handed back to traditional owners at a ceremony in England, in what is among the most significant repatriations of Indigenous objects to date.

title.children: 'Emotional moment' as spears taken by Captain Cook are returned to Indigenous community

image.altText: Couple smiles and holds hands on their wedding day, professional shot of woman with red hair up-do and wedding dress

props.synopsis: Horace Monching was getting ready for bed when he heard a noise outside. It was his neighbour, allegedly wielding a chainsaw, a court has heard. A tussle ensued, resulting in traumatic injuries.

title.children: Alleged victim fought off chainsaw-wielding neighbour with croquet mallet after dog dispute, court hears

image.altText: People crowd around a helicopter that has crashed on the ground.

props.synopsis: Malaysia's navy says two military helicopters have collided and crashed during a rehearsal, killing everyone on board.

title.children: Ten killed after two Malaysian navy helicopters collide mid-air

image.altText: Smiling woman breastfeeding her baby on a brown leather couch. She has a white muslin draped over her shoulder.

props.synopsis: We spoke to mothers to hear about their experiences of taking their breastfed babies to live gigs such as the theatre and concerts, including one who welcomes babies at shows of her own.

title.children: 'I thought we were past this': Mums share their experiences of taking breastfed babies to live gigs

image.altText: GWS Giants captain Toby Greene

props.synopsis: This is the eighth time in his career the GWS Giants captain has been suspended.

title.children: GWS Giants star Toby Greene's suspension upheld after AFL tribunal hearing

image.altText: Central Coast Mariners forward Angel Torres

props.synopsis: Central Coast Mariners striker Angel Torres was arrested on Monday in relation to an alleged sexual assault of a woman in March, and has been stood down by the club ahead of his court date next month.

title.children: Mariners forward Torres stood down amid sexual assault charge

image.altText: a small electric car plugged in to an electric charger inside a garage

props.synopsis: Amid plans by some automakers to hit the brakes on EV expansion plans, the International Energy Agency says demand is set to surge in 2024.

title.children: EV demand 'motoring along' as energy authority brushes off slowdown claims

image.altText: A smiling middle-aged husband and wife.

props.synopsis: Earlier this month Kerrie Lee Catling pleaded guilty to the 2021 manslaughter of her husband, Chris Catling. During sentencing today the court heard emotional statements from the family.

title.children: Mother of four jailed for fatally stabbing husband in their family home

image.altText: Wally Lewis speaks at the National Press Club of Australia

props.synopsis: League icon Wally Lewis has given a raw insight into his life after being diagnosed with probable CTE on the same day Sharks co-captain Dale Finucane was forced to retire due to repeated concussions.

title.children: 'Fear and anxiety': Lewis's CTE plea as concussions end Sharks star's career

image.altText: A man walks through journalists and cameras.

props.synopsis: The documents reveal Bruce Lehrmann refused an offer to settle with Network Ten and journalist Lisa Wilkinson before his failed defamation case began hearings. In a submission to the Federal Court, Mr Lehrmann argues he should be compensated for his legal costs, stating Ten embarked on a qualified privilege defence which was "bound to fail".

title.children: Bruce Lehrmann refused offer to settle defamation action with Ten before trial began, court documents reveal
